item.title: Report E-2024090562
item.description:
Report E-2024090562

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-27T09:15:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-25
  • City: CINCINNATI
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XCN experienced a UN1263 Durastar UC Medium Bronze BR4N160B release from a 55-gallon metal drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 3 ounces of product released to an 8’ x 4’ area of the trailer floor. The seam on the drum was damaged and leaked due to improper loading. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted area. The impacted absorbents and damaged drum were containerized into an 85-gallon poly overpack. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER CALLED TO RESPOND TO A LEAKING PACKAGE AT DOOR 70 IN THE OUTBOUND. DISCOVERED A HAZMAT SPRAYING FOAM OUT OF MULTIPLE PLACES ON THE BOX. OPENED THE PACKAGE, CLOSED THE VALVE ON THE CYLINDER, WORE REQUIRED PERSONAL PROTECTIVE EQUIPMENT (PPE), FOLLOWED THE DECISION TREE AND APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET, CLEANED UP AND REMOVED THE SPILL SAFELY

item.title: Report E-2024090517
item.description:
Report E-2024090517

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-27T09:15:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-13
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 13, 2024, two (2) 50-pound drums of UN3084 were damaged by a forklift and released approximately one (1) cup of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE placed two (2) damaged 50 gallon drums into two (2) 95-gallon overpacks. All unaffected freight was then restacked and rewrapped for future terminal shipping. A HEPA vacuum unit was used to retain any loose product from the dock floor. All debris and waste were collected and containerized into one (1) 35-gallon drum which was staged onsite for future disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024090534
item.description:
Report E-2024090534

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-27T09:15:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-10
  • City: NORTH RIDGEVILLE
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Hepaco was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 4ft-by-4ft area of the trailer floor and estimated that approximately two (2) quarts of material released from one (1) 330-gallon composite tote due to a loose cap. Hepaco personnel stated that prior to their arrival terminal personnel hand tightened the cap and the tote was shipped onsite the consignee. Hepaco personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and placed the spent absorbents into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024090541
item.description:
Report E-2024090541

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-27T09:15:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-30
  • City: UNIONTOWN
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 1848 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal XAC. It was reported that approximately 3 gallons of Acetone was released from a 5-gallon Jerrican due to improper loading. The release impacted trailer #3114010. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and they felt comfortable cleaning up the release with PPE available on-site. Terminal containerized the 5-gallon Jerrican of Acetone and waste was staged on site for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024090509
item.description:
Report E-2024090509

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-25T09:22:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-13
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 13, 2024, two (2) 5-gallon pails of UN1263 were crushed in transit and released approximately four (4) gallons of product to the trailer interior, exterior, and pavement below. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the trailer and on the pavement outside and swept them up with hand tools. Crews wiped down the impacted areas with absorbent pads, hand tools, and degrease. All spent absorbents and cleanup debris were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. Tthe damaged pails of paint were collected and containerized into one (1) other 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report X-2024091409
item.description:
Report X-2024091409

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-24T09:21:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-18
  • City: COLUMBUS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ABF states Regional Processing Specialist Elijah Sims was helping to unload trailer 85473 in dock door 43 when he saw a few 5 GAL pails of UN1760 Corrosive liquids, N.O.S, 8, PG I had leaked about 4 qt due to hanging off the pallet resulting in the fright to smash against the wall and bust open. ABF RPS stated that if they had loaded it correctly at the origin terminal, the freight wouldn't have rubbed up against the wall and spilled. ABF Safety advised RPS to block off the trailer until CURA has serviced it. CURA has been notified and dispatched to the terminal on emergency response. ABF advi sed RPS to send pictures to Safety.
